items.title: About 40 people killed in Swiss Alps resort fire
items.standfirst: About 40 people were killed and more than 100 injured after a fire broke out at a bar at a popular Swiss Alps ski resort town on New Year's Eve, according to police. The president of the Swiss Confederation, Guy Parmelin, said that many of the victims were young people and include Swiss residents as well as tourists from neighboring countries and elsewhere.
items.content: About 40 people were killed and more than 100 injured after a fire broke out at a bar at a popular Swiss Alps ski resort town on New Year's Eve, according to police. The president of the Swiss Confederation, Guy Parmelin, said that many of the victims were young people and include Swiss residents as well as tourists from neighboring countries and elsewhere.

items.title: Le Constellation bar fire in Switzerland: what we know so far
items.standfirst: Investigators say no indication of terrorism or arson after 40 people die and 115 are injured in blazeSwitzerland ski resort fire – latest updatesDozens of people are presumed dead and about 115 injured, many of them seriously, after a fire at a bar in the Swiss Alps during a new year celebration at a luxury ski resort.The blaze ripped through the packed bar, Le Constellation, early on Thursday in Crans-Montana, one of the top-ranked ski destinations in Europe, which lies about 25 miles (40km) north-west of Zermatt. It confirmed arson was not responsible, with the blaze thought to be the result of an accident. Continue reading...

items.title: Switzerland: New Year catastrophe in Swiss ski resort
items.standfirst: Several dozen people are presumed dead and roughly 100 more injured after a fire ripped through a bar during New Year's Eve celebrations in a luxury resort town in southern Switzerland, police said Thursday. The cause of the fire remains unknown, but Swiss authorities have said the incident is not being treated as an attack of any kind. France24 correspondent John Zarocostas reports.
items.content: Several dozen people are presumed dead and roughly 100 more injured after a fire ripped through a bar during New Year's Eve celebrations in a luxury resort town in southern Switzerland, police said Thursday. The cause of the fire remains unknown, but Swiss authorities have said the incident is not being treated as an attack of any kind. France24 correspondent John Zarocostas reports.

items.title: Deadly fire at Swiss ski resort: Many killed during New Year's celebrations
items.standfirst: A fire at a bar in the upscale Alpine ski resort of Crans-Montana just north of the Matterhorn, in Switzerland, has killed dozens of people and injured nearly 100 after breaking out around 1:30 a.m. at the Constellation bar, with investigators now working to determine the cause as authorities say there is no indication the blaze was terror-related. France24 correspondent, John Zarocostas, reports the latest.
items.content: A fire at a bar in the upscale Alpine ski resort of Crans-Montana just north of the Matterhorn, in Switzerland, has killed dozens of people and injured nearly 100 after breaking out around 1:30 a.m. at the Constellation bar, with investigators now working to determine the cause as authorities say there is no indication the blaze was terror-related. France24 correspondent, John Zarocostas, reports the latest.

items.title: Watch Live: NYC Mayor Zohran Mamdani's inauguration, address to New Yorkers

items.standfirst: Zohran Mamdani has officially been sworn in as mayor of New York, making him the first Muslim and first person of South Asian descent to hold the position. Mamdani’s swearing-in took place Thursday moments into the new year at a mostly closed gathering in a historic subway station beneath City…

Mamdani’s swearing-in took place Thursday moments into the new year at a mostly closed gathering in a historic subway station beneath City…

items.title: Zohran Mamdani becomes New York City mayor
items.standfirst: Zohran Mamdani became mayor of New York City just after midnight on Thursday, marking a historic moment with a low-key swearing-in ceremony held deep beneath Manhattan. The Democrat, who at 34 is the city’s youngest mayor in generations, takes office as one of the most closely watched political figures in the United States. Ellen Gainsford reports.
items.content: Zohran Mamdani became mayor of New York City just after midnight on Thursday, marking a historic moment with a low-key swearing-in ceremony held deep beneath Manhattan. The Democrat, who at 34 is the city’s youngest mayor in generations, takes office as one of the most closely watched political figures in the United States. Ellen Gainsford reports.

items.title: Zohran Mamdani sworn in, becoming NYC's 112th mayor
items.standfirst: In a private ceremony at the abandoned Old City Hall subway station​, Mamdani was sworn in by New York Attorney General Letitia James as the clock struck midnight on New Year's Eve.
items.content: In a private ceremony at the abandoned Old City Hall subway station​, Mamdani was sworn in by New York Attorney General Letitia James as the clock struck midnight on New Year's Eve.

items.title: Democratic socialist sworn in as New York mayor in old subway stop

items.content: New York's new mayor Zohran Mamdani has made history and been inaugurated in a disused subway station.

items.title: Zohran Mamdani sworn in as New York City mayor
items.standfirst: Zohran Mamdani has officially taken office as New York City’s mayor after a surprise victory last year in which the 34-year-old Democratic Socialist defeated former governor Andrew Cuomo, making history as the first Muslim and first Asian American to lead the nation’s largest city. Dean of the Finance department at INSEEC Business School, Ellen Kountz, shares her insights.
items.content: Zohran Mamdani has officially taken office as New York City’s mayor after a surprise victory last year in which the 34-year-old Democratic Socialist defeated former governor Andrew Cuomo, making history as the first Muslim and first Asian American to lead the nation’s largest city. Dean of the Finance department at INSEEC Business School, Ellen Kountz, shares her insights.

items.title: Zohran Mamdani sworn in as first Muslim New York City Mayor
items.standfirst: The Democratic politician took his oath over a Quran in the disused Old City Hall subway station.
items.content: The Democratic politician took his oath over a Quran in the disused Old City Hall subway station.

items.title: Zohran Mamdani sworn in as New York City mayor, capping historic rise
items.standfirst: Mayor Zohran Mamdani took the oath of office in New York City after midnight Thursday. The city's first Muslim mayor, a member of the Democratic Socialists of America, has promised to focus on affordability and fairness.
items.content: Mayor Zohran Mamdani took the oath of office in New York City after midnight Thursday. The city's first Muslim mayor, a member of the Democratic Socialists of America, has promised to focus on affordability and fairness.(Image credit: Pool)

items.title: Mamdani Takes Reins of New York City After Historic Election Win

items.content: Zohran Mamdani took office as New York City’s 112th mayor at the stroke of midnight, marking the culmination of his improbable, historic rise to power over the past year.

items.title: The history behind the NYC subway station chosen for Mamdani's swearing-in
items.standfirst: The city shut down the station in 1945 on New Year's Eve. Eighty years later, it's a symbolic venue choice for the incoming mayor's private swearing-in ceremony.
items.content: The city shut down the station in 1945 on New Year's Eve. Eighty years later, it's a symbolic venue choice for the incoming mayor's private swearing-in ceremony.(Image credit: Felix Lipov)

items.title: US health insurance costs to rise by 114% for millions as subsidies expire
items.standfirst: More than 20 million people in the United States will face sharply higher health insurance costs as of January 1 after enhanced tax credits that helped enrollees in the Affordable Care Act afford coverage expired overnight. The expiration of the subsidies will mostly affect families, small business owners and self-employed workers.
items.content: More than 20 million people in the United States will face sharply higher health insurance costs as of January 1 after enhanced tax credits that helped enrollees in the Affordable Care Act afford coverage expired overnight. The expiration of the subsidies will mostly affect families, small business owners and self-employed workers.

clusters.title: Putin voices confidence in war victory
clusters.neutral_headline: Putin voices confidence in war victory

items.title: Putin voices confidence in war victory
items.standfirst: Meanwhile, Russia says it will provide Washington with evidence that a Ukrainian drone targeted one of Vladimir Putin’s residences before being shot down on Monday, a claim Ukraine firmly denies. France24 International affairs editor Angela Diffley explains.
items.content: Meanwhile, Russia says it will provide Washington with evidence that a Ukrainian drone targeted one of Vladimir Putin’s residences before being shot down on Monday, a claim Ukraine firmly denies. France24 International affairs editor Angela Diffley explains.

items.title: Kyiv argues alleged attack on Putin’s home was Russian false-flag operation
items.standfirst: The CIA has concluded that Ukraine did not attempt to target Russian President Vladimir Putin or any of his residences in an attack earlier this week, an allegation Kyiv has firmly denied, saying the Kremlin is using the claim to harden its stance in peace negotiations aimed at ending the war in Ukraine. France24 International Affairs commentator Douglas Herbert shares his insights.
items.content: The CIA has concluded that Ukraine did not attempt to target Russian President Vladimir Putin or any of his residences in an attack earlier this week, an allegation Kyiv has firmly denied, saying the Kremlin is using the claim to harden its stance in peace negotiations aimed at ending the war in Ukraine. France24 International Affairs commentator Douglas Herbert shares his insights.

items.title: U.S. finds Ukraine did not try to kill Putin in alleged drone strike, source says
items.standfirst: A CIA assessment has concluded that Ukraine did not try to kill Russian President Vladimir Putin at his country residence as alleged by the Kremlin, a source with knowledge of the matter told NBC News
items.content: A CIA assessment has concluded that Ukraine did not try to kill Russian President Vladimir Putin at his country residence as alleged by the Kremlin, a source with knowledge of the matter told NBC News

clusters.title: Federal employees file complaint against Trump administration's ban on gender-affirming care
clusters.neutral_headline: US federal employees file complaint against ban on gender-affirming care

items.title: Federal employees file complaint against Trump administration's ban on gender-affirming care
items.standfirst: The complaint argues that denying coverage of gender-affirming care is sex-based discrimination and asks the personnel office to rescind the policy.
items.content: The complaint argues that denying coverage of gender-affirming care is sex-based discrimination and asks the personnel office to rescind the policy.

items.title: US federal employees file complaint against ban on gender-affirming care
items.standfirst: Complaint argues Trump administration denying coverage of gender-affirming care is sex-based discriminationThe Trump administration is facing a new legal complaint from a group of government employees who are affected by a new policy going into effect Thursday that eliminates coverage for gender-affirming care in federal health insurance programs.The complaint, filed Thursday on the employees’ behalf by the Human Rights Campaign, is in response to an August announcement from the Office of Personnel Management (OPM) that it would no longer cover “chemical and surgical modification of an individual’s sex traits through medical interventions” in health insurance programs for federal employees and US Postal Service workers. Continue reading...
items.content: Complaint argues Trump administration denying coverage of gender-affirming care is sex-based discriminationThe Trump administration is facing a new legal complaint from a group of government employees who are affected by a new policy going into effect Thursday that eliminates coverage for gender-affirming care in federal health insurance programs.The complaint, filed Thursday on the employees’ behalf by the Human Rights Campaign, is in response to an August announcement from the Office of Personnel Management (OPM) that it would no longer cover “chemical and surgical modification of an individual’s sex traits through medical interventions” in health insurance programs for federal employees and US Postal Service workers. Continue reading...

items.title: UK law firms get ready for crackdown on money laundering
items.standfirst: Harsher penalties and a ‘reshaping’ of the sector predicted when Financial Conduct Authority takes over as regulatorUK law firms are bracing themselves for a money-laundering crackdown as ministers race to improve the City’s reputation ahead of a fresh financial crime review.The Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) has been designated as the new anti-money laundering watchdog for the legal sector, in a move that experts warn could result in “sharper” penalties and ultimately reshape the industry. clusters.title: Israel’s NGO ban forces dozens of aid groups to suspend work in Gaza
clusters.neutral_headline: Israel’s NGO ban forces dozens of aid groups to suspend work in Gaza

items.title: Israel’s NGO ban forces dozens of aid groups to suspend work in Gaza
items.standfirst: Israel is revoking the licenses of 37 international organisations, forcing them to stop operations in Gaza.
items.content: Israel is revoking the licenses of 37 international organisations, forcing them to stop operations in Gaza.

items.title: Israel says it will 'enforce' ban on 37 NGOs in Gaza as humanitarian crisis deepens
items.standfirst: Dozens of international humanitarian organisations will be banned from operating in the devastated Gaza Strip after Israel said the groups had not complied with a deadline to meet "security and transparency standards". A number of aid groups have refused to submit a list of their Palestinian staff over fears they will be targeted by Israel.
items.content: Dozens of international humanitarian organisations will be banned from operating in the devastated Gaza Strip after Israel said the groups had not complied with a deadline to meet "security and transparency standards". A number of aid groups have refused to submit a list of their Palestinian staff over fears they will be targeted by Israel.

items.title: US military says five killed in latest strike on alleged drug boats
items.standfirst: The latest strike comes as the US Coast Guard searches for survivors of another that happened a day earlier.
items.content: The latest strike comes as the US Coast Guard searches for survivors of another that happened a day earlier.

items.title: U.S. military strikes 5 more alleged drug boats, killing 8
items.standfirst: The U.S. military says it struck five alleged drug-smuggling boats over two days. The attacks killed eight people, while others jumped overboard and may have survived. U.S. Southern Command did not reveal where the attacks occurred.
items.content: The U.S. military says it struck five alleged drug-smuggling boats over two days. The attacks killed eight people, while others jumped overboard and may have survived. U.S. Southern Command did not reveal where the attacks occurred.(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
